movies.title: Unfinished Business
movies.plot: Spring, 1942: F.D.R. signs executive order 9066, and more than 110,000 Japanese Americans, most of them U.S. citizens, are sent to internment camps. Three young men - Min Yasui, an attorney from Oregon, Gordon Hirabayashi, a Quaker college student in Washington, and Fred Korematsu, a Bay Area welder - serve jail sentences for violating laws against Japanese Americans; the U.S. Supreme Court upholds their convictions. Forty years later, the three file suits to have their sentences overturned. This documentary tells their stories and helps break 40 years of silence and shame. By the end of the documentary, the court proceedings remain unfinished.
movies.simplePlot: Spring, 1942: F.D.R. signs executive order 9066, and more than 110,000 Japanese Americans, most of them U.S. citizens, are sent to internment camps. Three young men - Min Yasui, an attorney...

biography.bio: Amy Hill was born on May 9, 1953 in Deadwood, South Dakota, USA. She is an actress and writer, known for 50 First Dates (2004), Lilo & Stitch (2002) and The Cat in the Hat (2003).
biography.name: Amy Hill

biography.bio: Gordon Hirabayashi was born on April 23, 1918 in Seattle, Washington, USA. He was married to Susan Carnahan and Esther Schmoe. He died on January 2, 2012 in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada.
biography.name: Gordon Hirabayashi

biography.bio: Fred Korematsu was born on January 30, 1919 in Oakland, California, USA as Fred Toyosaburo Korematsu. He was married to Katherine Korematsu. He died on March 30, 2005 in Larkspur, California.
biography.name: Fred Korematsu

biography.bio: It looks like we don't have any Biography for Min Yasui yet.
biography.name: Min Yasui
